goals.title: How Your Donations Help
goals.description: Your support directly funds boats, equipment, and training for the UK delegation's contribution to the Spring 2026 flotilla.

items.title: Boats & Equipment
items.description: Acquire and equip boats for the flotilla. Cover repairs, safety checks, GPS, communications, cameras, and essential maritime equipment needed for the journey to Gaza.

items.title: Training & Coordination
items.description: Train and coordinate UK volunteers and crews. Provide safety gear, communication tools, and prepare departure logistics from European ports.

items.title: International Solidarity
items.description: Contribute to the €3 million international fundraising target. The UK delegation is one of many worldwide working together to break the blockade.

getInvolved.title: Get Involved
getInvolved.description: Sailing in Spring 2026. Support our mission by donating or join the UK delegation to help organize boats breaking the siege on Gaza.

joinDelegation.title: Join the UK Delegation
points: Whether you're living in the UK, have ties here, or want to help out from afar - we welcome you
Join us in organising boats heading towards Gaza in spring 2026.
If have notable skills or simply commitment to the cause, there's a place for you.

events.title: Upcoming Events
events.description: Join us at events across the UK as we prepare for the Spring 2026 flotilla.

events.title: Gaza Sunbirds Festival of Comedy
events.shortDescription: Join us for a night of comedy raising funds for Gaza Sunbirds, with proceeds going toward humanitarian aid and the a Sunbirds boat as part of the 1000 Madleens flotilla.
events.fullDescription:
Line up: Ivo Graham, Amir El-Masry, Fatiha El-Ghorri, Karl Porter, Finlay Christie, Thomas Green, Tez Ilyas, Sami Abu Wardeh, Sukina Noor (poem)

This January, Palestine’s para-cycling team, the Gaza Sunbirds, will bring London crowds together for an evening of comedy and poetry in support of Palestine. With a lineup featuring Ivo Graham, Amir El-Masry, Fatiha El-Ghorri and Thomas Green, the squad of amputee athletes and their community have programmed a very special event at beloved Islington venue, Union Chapel.

The Gaza Sunbirds have gained global recognition over the last two years for their courageous aid missions in the strip. The team formed in 2020 with a dream of representing Palestine on the sporting world stage. Forced to give up their training regime in 2023 due to the Israeli bombardment, they turned their attention to supporting their local community. Since then, they have been risking their lives on one leg to distribute $520,000+ USD worth of food and supplies in Southern and central Gaza. The show will fundraise for their work in the strip as well as international goals such as entering Palestine's first para-cyclists to the LA 2028 Paralympics. A portion of the proceeds will also go to Thousand Madleens to Gaza, a citizen led initiative aiming to break the siege on Gaza.

*This event is for 16+, under 18s must be accompanied by an adult

events.title: Flotilla Launh
events.location: The Old Print Works, 498-506 Moseley Rd, Balsall Heath, Birmingham
events.shortDescription: TMTG & Activist Independent Movement present an evening of live entertainment and speakers to launch the 2026 Flotilla.

events.title: National March
events.shortDescription: Israel’s genocide against the Palestinian people has not ended. Join us for our next march for Palestine to demand our government end its complicity in Israel’s violence.
events.fullDescription:
END THE GENOCIDE – HANDS OFF GAZA – STOP ARMING ISRAEL

Israel’s genocide against the Palestinian people has not ended. Join us for our next march for Palestine to demand our government end its complicity in Israel’s violence.

Join us on Saturday 31 January for the first national march for Palestine in 2026. Assemble 12 noon in Central London.

pressRelease.title: Official Press Release
pressRelease.subtitle: Freedom Flotilla Coalition & Thousand Madleens to Gaza Unite

keyMessages: We sail because silence is betrayal
We sail because Gaza must live
We sail because Palestine must be free

sections.title: Two initiatives, one flotilla, one mission
sections.content: The Freedom Flotilla Coalition (FFC) and Thousand Madleens to Gaza (TMTG) are joining forces as one flotilla to challenge Israel's illegal and deadly siege of Gaza. This alliance unites two global, people-led initiatives in a shared commitment to justice and solidarity with the Palestinian people.

On September 24th, 2025, we will launch the next wave of civilian ships to Gaza from Catania following the first boats of the Global Sumud Flotilla now en route to Palestine's shores. It continues a legacy of resistance that began with the Free Gaza Movement in 2008 and FFC's missions since 2010. We sail because world powers enable Israel's illegal siege. We sail to break it, to defy complicity, and to affirm the rights of Palestinians in Gaza.

sections.title: Why this alliance matters
sections.content: This partnership is rooted in years of experience and grassroots organizing. By consolidating maritime safety, legal defence, and communications, we strengthen coordination, safety, messaging, and global impact to confront what governments, corporations and institutions have abandoned—to stop genocide, resist apartheid and demand accountability under international law. We sail because silence is betrayal. We sail because Gaza must live. We sail because Palestine must be free!

sections.title: Why now
sections.content: Israel's illegal siege of Gaza is both a humanitarian emergency and a political crime. Gaza is being annihilated, and her people deliberately starved, bombed, and erased by Israel and their allies. Children are dying of hunger and disease, denied food, clean water, medicine, and the basic right to live with dignity.

Since October 2023, Israel's genocidal assault has turned an already suffocating illegal blockade into a catastrophe. Yet our governments continue to arm, fund, and profit from this horror. We cannot wait for permission. We cannot wait for leaders who have chosen complicity over humanity. The urgency demands not one ship, but waves of ships.

Israel's recent armed attacks on the FFC's vessels—Conscience, Madleen, and Handala—ignited a worldwide response. Dozens of boats from across the globe have since joined the Global Sumud Flotilla, proving that the demand to break Israel's illegal siege on Gaza cannot be silenced or deterred.

announcement.callToAction: We invite media to attend our launch event in Catania prior to the launch date to give ample time for interviews. Please contact media@freedomflotilla.org or thousand.madleens@proton.me
announcement.title: Freedom Flotilla Coalition & Thousand Madleens to Gaza unite to sail for Gaza on September 24th
announcement.description: Two initiatives, one flotilla, one mission. The Freedom Flotilla Coalition (FFC) and Thousand Madleens to Gaza (TMTG) are joining forces as one flotilla to challenge Israel's illegal and deadly siege of Gaza.

site.title: Thousand Madleens to Gaza UK Delegation
site.description: UK Delegation - Part of a global civilian flotilla sailing Spring 2026 to break Israel's illegal blockade on Gaza.
site.campaignMessage: Join the UK delegation! ⛵ Sailing Spring 2026 as part of #1000MadleensToGaza - a global civilian flotilla to break Israel's illegal blockade. #FreePalestine #BreakTheBlockade

cards.title: UK Delegation's Role
cards.description:
We are UK-based medics, sailors, and grassroots organisers working as part of the international Thousand Madleens network.

We're raising funds to acquire boats, equipment, and training for the UK's contribution to the global flotilla sailing in Spring 2026.

cards.title: Why This Matters
cards.description:
The UK Government is an active and complicit partner in Israel's genocide. This makes it crucial that UK citizens object and raise the alarm internationally.

We stand on the right side of history. Together, we're organizing to show the world that the people demand justice for Palestine.

socialMedia.title: Stay Connected
socialMedia.description: Email us directly or follow our journey on social media.

backgroundImage.alt: Sailboat with Palestinian flag sailing on the Mediterranean Sea - Thousand Madleens to Gaza campaign

hero.title: Thousand Madleens to Gaza UK Delegation
hero.subtitle: Breaking the Israeli Blockade
hero.description: The UK delegation is part of an international citizen movement organizing a peaceful civilian flotilla to challenge Israel's illegal blockade on Gaza. Sailing Spring 2026 with boats from across the world to deliver aid and break the siege.

footer.description: Breaking the blockade through peaceful solidarity and international cooperation.

copyright.text: 1000 Madleens to Gaza Campaign. All rights reserved.

points.title: Peaceful Mission
points.description: The 1000 Madleens to Gaza campaign is committed to peaceful, non-violent resistance. All participants must agree to strict non-violence protocols.

points.title: Legal Risks
points.description: Participants should be aware that this mission may involve legal risks, including potential detention or legal proceedings. We recommend consulting with legal counsel before participating.

points.title: Safety First
points.description: Maritime operations carry inherent risks. All vessels must meet safety standards, and participants must have appropriate maritime experience or training.

points.title: International Law
points.description: This campaign operates within the framework of international maritime law and the principles of civil disobedience in challenging what we consider to be violations of international law.

points.title: Independent Participation
points.description: Participation in this campaign is voluntary and at your own risk. The campaign organizers cannot be held responsible for individual decisions or consequences.
